p: PREC, TMEDMAX (for the 1971 to 2000 period) and SLOPE were derived from spatial data layers of the Environmental Information Network of Andalusia ( http://www.juntadeandalucia.es/medioambiente/site/web/rediam). PREC and TMEDMAX had a cell size (100 x 100 m), and SLOPE was calculated from a 20x20 m pixel digital elevation model of Andalusia. We resampled to the 231 x 231 m grid (pixel size of the MOD13Q1 EVI products, see below) using bilinear resampling, in Quantum GIS (QGIS; http://www.qgis.org) which is more realistic than nearest-neighbor interpolation [ 26]. This pixel resolution is suitable to capture the habitat preferences of the European badger at a local scale [ 8].
